00108    #define UART_RECEIVE_COMPLETE                RXC

00201 #define usart0_mode(x) (UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_C = (UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_C & (uint8_t)~((1<<UART_MODE_SELECT_0)|(1<<UART_MODE_SELECT_1))) | (uint8_t)((x) << UART_MODE_SELECT_0))
00202 
00203 
00204 #define usart0_clock_polarity(x)    bit_write(x, UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_C, BIT(UCPOL0))
00205 
00206 #define usart0_transmit_enable()    (UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_B |= (uint8_t)(1 << UART_ENABLE_TRANSMITTER))
00207 #define usart0_transmit_disable()   (UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_B &= (uint8_t)~(1 << UART_ENABLE_TRANSMITTER))
00208 
00209 #define usart0_receive_enable()     (UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_B |= (uint8_t)(1 << UART_ENABLE_RECEIVER))
00210 #define usart0_receive_disable()    (UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_B &= (uint8_t)~(1 << UART_ENABLE_RECEIVER))
00211 
00212 #define usart0_transmit_speed_double_enable()   (UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_A |= (uint8_t)(1 << UART_DOUBLE_SPEED))
00213 #define usart0_transmit_speed_double_disable()  (UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_A &= (uint8_t)~(1 << UART_DOUBLE_SPEED))
00214 
00215 #define usart0_receive_complete()           bit_read(UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_A, BIT(UART_RECEIVE_COMPLETE))
00216 
00217 #define usart0_transmit_complete()          bit_read(UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_A, BIT(UART_TRANSMIT_COMPLETE))
00218 
00219 #define usart0_data_register_empty()        bit_read(UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_A, BIT(UART_READY_TO_TRANSMIT))
00220 
00221 #define usart0_frame_error()                bit_read(UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_A, BIT(UART_FRAME_ERROR))
00222 
00223 #define usart0_data_overrun()               bit_read(UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_A, BIT(UART_DATA_OVER_RUN))
00224 
00225 #define usart0_parity_error()               bit_read(UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_A, BIT(UART_PARITY_ERROR))
00226 
00227 #define usart0_multiprocessor_mode(x)       bit_write(x, UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_A, BIT(UART_MULTI-PROCESSOR_COMMUNICATION_MODE))
00228 
00229 #define usart0_receive_complete_interrupt_enable()      (UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_B |= (uint8_t)(1 << UART_RX_COMPLETE_INTERRUPT_ENABLE))
00230 #define usart0_receive_complete_interrupt_disable()     (UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_B &= (uint8_t)~(1 << UART_RX_COMPLETE_INTERRUPT_ENABLE))
00231 
00232 #define usart0_receive_complete_interrupt_get()         (UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_B & (1 << UART_RX_COMPLETE_INTERRUPT_ENABLE))
00233 
00234 #define usart0_transmit_complete_interrupt_enable()     UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_B |= (uint8_t)(1 << UART_TX_COMPLETE_INTERRUPT_ENABLE)
00235 #define usart0_transmit_complete_interrupt_disable()    UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_B &= (uint8_t)~(1 << UART_TX_COMPLETE_INTERRUPT_ENABLE)
00236 
00237 #define usart0_transmit_complete_interrupt_get()        (UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_B & (1 << TXCIE0))
00238 
00239 #define usart0_data_register_empty_interrupt_enable()   (UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_B |= (uint8_t)(1 << UART_DATA_REGISTER_EMPTY_INTERRUPT_ENABLE))
00240 #define usart0_data_register_empty_interrupt_disable()  (UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_B &= (uint8_t)~(1 << UART_DATA_REGISTER_EMPTY_INTERRUPT_ENABLE))
00241 
00242 #define usart0_data_register_empty_interrupt_get()      bit_read(UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_B, BIT(UART_DATA_REGISTER_EMPTY_INTERRUPT_ENABLE))
00243 
00244 #define usart0_receive_data_bit_8(x)                    bit_write(x, UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_B, BIT(UART_RX_DATA_BIT_8))
00245 
00246 #define usart0_transmit_data_bit_8(x)                   bit_write(x, UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_B, BIT(UART_tX_DATA_BIT_8))
00247 
00248 #define usart0_stop_bits_set(stop_bits) \
00249 do{                                     \
00250     if((stop_bits) >= 1 && (stop_bits) <= 2)    \
00251     {                                           \
00252         bit_write((stop_bits) - 1, UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_C, BIT(UART_STOP_BIT_SELECT)); \
00253     }                                           \
00254 }while(0)
00255 
00256 
00257 #define usart0_data_bits_set(data_bits) \
00258 do{         \
00259     if((data_bits) >= 5 && (data_bits) <= 8)    \
00260     {       \
00261         bit_write(bit_read(((data_bits) - 5), BIT(0)), UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_C, BIT(UART_CHARACTER_SIZE_0)); \
00262         bit_write(bit_read(((data_bits) - 5), BIT(1)), UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_C, BIT(UART_CHARACTER_SIZE_1)); \
00263         bit_clear(UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_B, BIT(UART_CHARACTER_SIZE_2));     \
00264     }       \
00265     if((data_bits) == 9)    \
00266     {       \
00267         bit_set(UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_C, BIT(UART_CHARACTER_SIZE_0));    \
00268         bit_set(UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_C, BIT(UART_CHARACTER_SIZE_1));    \
00269         bit_set(UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_B, BIT(UART_CHARACTER_SIZE_2));    \
00270     }       \
00271 }while(0)
00272 
00273 #define usart0_rts_enable()     bit_clear(USART0_RTS_PORT, USART0_RTS)
00274 
00275 #define usart0_rts_disable()    bit_set(USART0_RTS_PORT, USART0_RTS)
00276 
00277 #define usart0_rts_init()   \
00278 do{     \
00279     usart0_rts_enable();    \
00280     bit_set(USART0_RTS_PORT_DIRECTION, USART0_RTS); \
00281 }while(0)
00282

00284 
00285 #define usart0_cts_init()   \
00286 do{     \
00287     bit_clear(USART0_CTS_PORT_DIRECTION, USART0_CTS); \
00288 }while(0)

00300 // Removed from usart.h since it isn't available in the API
00301 /*
00302  \ingroup usart
00303 
00304     \brief Puts a character into the usart transmit buffer.
00305          
00306     \param c the char to be sent.
00307         \param stream a pointer to the C output stream. 
00308 
00309         The C output stream is attached with the following:
00310         \code
00311         FILE mystdout = FDEV_SETUP_STREAM(usart0_put_char, NULL, _FDEV_SETUP_WRITE);
00312         \endcode
00313         See the avrlibc manual for details
00314 
00315         \return 0
00316 
00317 */
00318 int usart0_put_char_stream(char c, FILE *stream);
00319 
00320 // Keep this in the same file as the usart0_put_char function
00321 FILE mystdout = FDEV_SETUP_STREAM(usart0_put_char_stream, NULL, _FDEV_SETUP_WRITE);
00322 int usart0_put_char_stream(char c, FILE *stream) 
00323 { 
00324         if (c == '\n') usart0_put_char_stream('\r', stream);
00325 
00326         usart0_transmit_buffer_insert((uint8_t)c);
00327         
00328         usart0_send();
00329 
00330         return 0; 
00331 }

00333 void usart0_init(uint32_t baud, uint32_t freq_cpu, usart_mode_t mode, usart_databits_t databits, usart_stopbits_t stopbits, usart_parity_t parity, usart_flow_control_t flow_control)
00334 {
00335 
00336         cli();
00337 
00338         stdout = &mystdout;    //set the output stream 
00339 
00340     //flow.flow_control = flow_control;
00341     //flow.flow_out = true;
00342     //flow.flow_in = true;
00343 
00344         // JWP 3/27/11 the following was already commented out in xxx code
00345     // Initialize hw flow control task.
00346     // flow_out_tcb.handler = usart0_flow_out_hw_task;
00347     // flow_out_tcb.absolute_timing = false;
00348     // flow_out_tcb.run_interval = 0;
00349     // flow_out_tcb.enabled = false;
00350     // task_add(&flow_out_tcb);
00351 
00352  
00353         usart0_transmit_disable();
00354     usart0_receive_disable();
00355         usart0_transmit_complete_interrupt_disable();
00356     usart0_receive_complete_interrupt_disable();
00357 
00358 //  JWP 6/19/11 Just use default while testing
00359 // TODO: figure this out someday   
00360 //      usart0_mode(mode);
00361         usart0_baud_set(baud, freq_cpu);
00362     usart0_data_bits_set(databits);
00363     usart0_stop_bits_set(stopbits);
00364     usart0_parity_set(parity);
00365  
00366         usart0_baud_set(baud, freq_cpu);
00367 
00368 //JWP 6/16/11 The Butterfly requires special code for clock and baud
00369 #if defined(__AVR_ATmega169__) // Assume Butterfly
00370         butterfly_init();
00371 #endif
00372 
00373 
00374         ring_init(&usart0_receive_ring, usart0_receive_buffer, USART0_RECEIVE_BUFFER_LEN);
00375     ring_init(&usart0_transmit_ring, usart0_transmit_buffer, USART0_TRANSMIT_BUFFER_LEN);
00376 
00377         // JWP 6/16/11 
00378         usart0_transmit_enable();
00379     usart0_receive_enable();
00380         usart0_transmit_complete_interrupt_enable();
00381     usart0_receive_complete_interrupt_enable();
00382 
00383         // JWP 6/16/11 - set flags for revised transmission logic
00384         usart_buffered_tx_flag = false;
00385         usart_tx_ready_flag = true;
00386 
00387         sei();
00388 
00389         return;
00390 }

00392 
00393 void usart0_uninit(void)
00394 {
00395         // restore to datasheet defaults
00396         UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_A = 0x20;
00397         UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_B = 0;
00398         UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_C = 0x06;
00399 }
00400 
00401 
00402 // JWP 6/16/11 added to change transmission logic.
00403 // this function waits until a pending transmission is complete
00404 // then sends a byte. If the usart_buffered_TX_flag is set true
00405 // then the ISR continues to send until the buffer is empty, otherwise
00406 // the ISR just sends the byte. 
00407 void usart0_send(void)
00408 {
00409 
00410         // Wait until the transmitter is ready
00411         while(!usart_tx_ready_flag);
00412 
00413         // Set flag for ISR
00414         usart_buffered_tx_flag = true;
00415         
00416         // Send the byte
00417         UART_DATA_REG = ring_remove(&usart0_transmit_ring);
00418 
00419         // Set the ready flag to false
00420         usart_tx_ready_flag = false;
00421 }
00422 
00423 
00424 // 3/18/11 JWP removed magic number for clock and added freq_cpu
00425 void usart0_baud_set(uint32_t baudrate, uint32_t freq_cpu)
00426 {
00427         uint16_t setting;
00428         
00429         setting = usart_baudrate_to_setting(freq_cpu,baudrate);
00430         
00431         // Write hi byte first as writing lo byte will trigger immediate update of baud prescaler.
00432         UART_BAUD_RATE_HIGH = hi_byte(setting);
00433         UART_BAUD_RATE_LOW= lo_byte(setting);
00434         
00435         return;
00436 }
00437 
00438 void usart0_parity_set(usart_parity_t parity)
00439 {
00440     if(parity > 0)
00441     {
00442         parity++;
00443     }
00444     bit_write(bit_read(parity, BIT(0)), UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_C, BIT(UART_PARITY_MODE_0));
00445     bit_write(bit_read(parity, BIT(1)), UART_CONTROL_STATUS_REG_C, BIT(UART_PARITY_MODE_1));
00446     return;
00447 }
00448 
00449 // JWP 6/16/11 rewrote transmit interrupt to use TX complete vector
00450 // rather than the Data Register Empty vector
00451 // The interrupt service routines are included in the initialization .c file 
00452 // since they must be associated with a .c file for the compiler
00453 usart0_transmit_interrupt_service_routine
00454 {
00455 
00456         // Is buffered transmission enabled?
00457         if(usart_buffered_tx_flag)
00458         {               
00459                 //if(usart0_transmit_ring.count)// Alternate technique
00460                 if(usart0_transmit_buffer_inuse_count())// Is there data in the buffer?
00461                 {
00462                         // Send next byte in the buffer.
00463                UART_DATA_REG = ring_remove(&usart0_transmit_ring);
00464                 }
00465                 else
00466                 {
00467                         // The buffer is empty
00468                         usart_buffered_tx_flag = false;
00469                         // Set the ready flag
00470                         usart_tx_ready_flag = true;
00471                 }
00472         }
00473         else // Not buffered so transmited single byte
00474         {
00475                 // Set transmit ready flag
00476                 usart_tx_ready_flag = true;
00477         }
00478         
00479     return;
00480 }
00481 
00482 
00483 // The interrupt service routines are included in the initialization .c file 
00484 // since they must be associated with a .c file for the compiler
00485 usart0_receive_interrupt_service_routine
00486 {
00487         register uint8_t data;
00488         register uint8_t parity_error = false;
00489         register uint8_t frame_error = false;
00490 
00491         // Get error conditions before getting the data.
00492         frame_error = usart0_frame_error();
00493         parity_error = usart0_parity_error();
00494         
00495         data = UART_DATA_REG;
00496     
00497         if(!frame_error && !parity_error)
00498         {
00499                 // Store data in ring buffer.
00500         ring_add(&usart0_receive_ring, data);
00501         }
00502 
00503         return;
00504 }
